body_html:
tf1.2 doc on this is deprecated. We started to have more usable CudnnRNN classes since 1.6.

It probably doesn't help you achieve much by querying the size of opaque params, which is subject to change depending on cudnn version.

To share params between CudnnLSTM and CudnnCompatibleLSTM, one could export a CudnnLSTM checkpoint and import into a CudnnCompatibleLSTM graph. Check this unittest for an example how that could be done.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/contrib/cudnn_rnn/python/kernel_tests/cudnn_rnn_test.py#L904

tf1.2 doc on this is deprecated. We started to have more usable CudnnRNN classes since 1.6.
It probably doesn't help you achieve much by querying the size of opaque params, which is subject to change depending on cudnn version.
To share params between CudnnLSTM and CudnnCompatibleLSTM, one could export a CudnnLSTM checkpoint and import into a CudnnCompatibleLSTM graph. Check this unittest for an example how that could be done.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/contrib/cudnn_rnn/python/kernel_tests/cudnn_rnn_test.py#L904
body:
tf1.2 doc on this is deprecated. We started to have more usable CudnnRNN classes since 1.6.

It probably doesn't help you achieve much by querying the size of opaque params, which is subject to change depending on cudnn version.

To share params between CudnnLSTM and CudnnCompatibleLSTM, one could export a CudnnLSTM checkpoint and import into a CudnnCompatibleLSTM graph. Check this unittest for an example how that could be done.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/contrib/cudnn_rnn/python/kernel_tests/cudnn_rnn_test.py#L904
